definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: There are a hundred lovely children on both sides of a pair of tiny little snuff-boxes.
sentences.chinese: 在一对微型鼻烟壶内面，画有一百个可爱的娃娃。

sentences.english: She bought her father a snuff bottle.
Creamy agate snuff bottle with two small ears on the shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 紫罗兰色玛瑙鼻烟壶，肩上小耳。

sentences.english: Inside painting snuff bottle is a traditional Chinese folk art.
sentences.chinese: 内画鼻烟壶是我国传统的民间工艺。

sentences.english: Like Japanese netsuke, snuff bottles were designed as hand-held treasures.
sentences.chinese: 像日本坠子一样，鼻烟壶被设计成手持的珍品。

sentences.english: In Three Li Ma Dashuai home found snuff bottle is treasure.
sentences.chinese: 李三在马大帅家发现了宝藏至关重要的鼻烟壶。

sentences.english: Napoleon laughed malignantly, and again put his snuff-box to his nose.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑恶意地笑了笑，又把鼻烟壶凑到了鼻子跟前。

sentences.english: Snuff bottles. At far right is one made of exquisite inlaid glass from the Ching dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 鼻烟壶，最右边的是清朝制造的玻璃镶嵌精品。

sentences.english: By marketing the snuff bottles online, the auction house would seriously reduce the costs associated with the sale.
sentences.chinese: 通过在线销售鼻烟壶，该拍卖行可大大降低交易费用。

sentences.english: The snuff bottle spreads to China with the snuff in late Ming Dynasty .
sentences.chinese: 鼻烟壶是在明朝末年伴随着鼻烟的传入而进入中国。

definition: ornamental thumb ring (originally a ring, often made from jade, worn by archers in ancient times to protect the right thumb when drawing a bowstring)
water pot or goblet (for Chinese calligraphy)
